org.apache.felix.ipojo
Class EventDispatcher

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.felix.ipojo.EventDispatcher
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener
public final class EventDispatcher
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener

iPOJO Internal event dispatcher. This class provides an internal service event dispatcher in order to tackle the event storm that can happen when starting large-scale applications.

Author:
Felix Project Team
See Also:
Extender

Field Detail

DISPATCHER

private static EventDispatcher DISPATCHER
The internal event dispatcher. This dispatcher is a singleton.

m_listeners

private java.util.Map m_listeners
The list of listeners. Service interface -> List of ServiceListener

m_context

private org.osgi.framework.BundleContext m_context
The global bundle context.

Constructor Detail

EventDispatcher

private EventDispatcher(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bc)
Creates the EventDispatcher.

Parameters:
bc - the bundle context used to register and unregister ServiceListener.
Method Detail

create

public static void create(org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bc)
Creates the internal event dispatcher.

Parameters:
bc - the iPOJO bundle context to send to the internal event dispatcher.

dispose

public static void dispose()
Stops and delete the internal event dispatcher. This method must be call only if iPOJO is stopping.

getDispatcher

public static EventDispatcher getDispatcher()
Gets the iPOJO event dispatcher.

Returns:
the event dispatcher or null if not created.

stop

private void stop()
Stops the event dispatcher. This method unregisters the ServiceListener. This methods must be called only when the iPOJO bundle stops.

serviceChanged

public void serviceChanged(org.osgi.framework.ServiceEvent event)
Method called when a ServiceEvent is fired by the OSGi framework. According to the event, this method dispatches to interested registered listers from the m_listeners map.

Specified by:
serviceChanged in interface org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener
Parameters:
event - the service event
See Also:
ServiceListener.serviceChanged(org.osgi.framework.ServiceEvent)

addListener

public void addListener(java.lang.String itf,
                        org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener listener)
Adds a new service listener to the m_listeners map. This method specifies the listen service interface

Parameters:
itf - the service interface
listener - the service listener

removeListener

public boolean removeListener(org.osgi.framework.ServiceListener listener)
Removes a service listener.

Parameters:
listener - the service listener to remove
Returns:
true if the listener is successfully removed.
